alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Spalding (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 10:53AM EST until January 12 at 4:36AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Flint River near Lovejoy affecting Spalding, Clayton and Fayette Counties. Flint River at US 19 near Carsonville affecting Talbot, Taylor, Crawford and Upson Counties. Flint River near Griffin affecting Spalding and Fayette Counties. For the Flint River Basin...including Americus, Peachtree City, Lovejoy, Fayetteville, Peachtree City, Woolsey, Sharpsburg, Peachtree City, Peachtree City, Senoia, Griffin, Orchard Hill, Griffin, Thomaston, Molena, Carsonville, Montezuma, Byromville... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Flint River near Griffin. * WHEN...Until early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Minor flooding expands further into the woodlands...fields and pasture upstream and downstream from the gage on Georgia Highway 16 or Newnan Road. The backyards of homes at the end of Landing Way upstream from the bridge will be flooded with around two feet of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 13.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM EST Wednesday was 13.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.6 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.9 feet on 01/15/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1100 PM EST.
